@graph.text: Do you make your own cookie icing?

headline: Gingerbread Cookies
name: Gingerbread Cookies
recipeIngredient: Sugar Cookie Icing, for decorating
recipeInstructions: In a large bowl using a hand mixer, beat butter, brown sugar, and molasses until fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add egg and vanilla and beat until combined. In a medium bowl, whisk flour, spices, baking soda, and salt until combined. With the mixer on low, gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, as well as  fresh ginger, orange zest, and black pepper (if using), until dough just comes together. (Do not overmix!) Divide dough in half and create two discs. Wrap each in plastic wrap and chill until firm, about 2 to 3 hours. (Alternatively, divide dough in half and roll each piece of dough between two pieces of parchment to 1/4" thick. Chill until firm.) Preheat oven to 350° and line two large baking sheets with parchment paper. Place one disc of dough on a lightly floured surface and roll until 1/4" thick. (Alternatively, peel off both sheets of parchment from dough, then replace one sheet of parchment back underneath dough.) Cut out gingerbread men with a 3" wide cutter and transfer to baking sheets. Bake until slightly puffed and set, 9 to 10 minutes, depending on the size of your cookie cutters. Let cool on baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack to cool completely.   Repeat with remaining disc of dough. Decorate with icing and sprinkles as desired.

video.description: Crispy on the edges, soft and chewy on the inside—this gingerbread cookie's got the best of both worlds. Add a little extra fresh ginger, citrus zest, and black pepper for that ka-pow spicy kick!
video.name: The Gingerbread Cookie That's Not Afraid To Be Spicy

review.reviewBody: Super delicious!! I left the dough in the fridge overnight and it really allowed the flavors to come together. Easy bake. I did about 8 minutes, flipping them around at the midpoint. Two thumbs up, we’ll bake again!

I made the dough ahead of time a couple days ago. I don’t own a hand mixer or a stand mixer so I just mixed with a whisk and a wooden spoon. These cookies turned out great! I found that 6 minutes was just enough time for baking them in my oven as it runs hotter than most. They are a hit! I love this recipe and I will be making them again! I also used vegetable oil instead of butter because the only butter I have is frozen.

This was my first time trying this with my gf we started doing this at 4pm on Saturday then realized the directions said they had to go in fridge for 2-3 hours and she had to work at 7 so i took her to work and decided ill try to bake them myself. Welllllll it started off with me taking the dough out putting it all in a pan just to then realize i forgot to put the parchment paper or something down under the dough. Got mad ran to giant eagle since its 10 seconds from my house got back 5 minutes later to find out there was a reason it needed to be in the fridge for 2-3 hours cause now it was sticky and i couldnt form it. So i put it back in the fridge and went to my room called her and told her im done and she can do it when she comes back over. Now its monday and i said ill give it a second try since shes with her family. And i got it on the sheet made a make shift roller out of a can cut it out and now im about to throw it in the oven. This tasks takes alot of patience. P.S. also will be my first time even eating gingerbread men. Im 22
I made these cookies last year for my friends and had to come back to this recipe. Best cookies I’ve ever made!!

I have never written a bad review before. I followed this recipe to the letter, left it to chill an extra hour (4 hours total) It was still SO sticky! I attempted to roll it out and it melted in to my counter. I had to use a metal spatula to remove it. No matter how much flour I added, it didn't help. I ended up just making rough circles and cooking those. I cooked them for 16 minutes and they kind of came out? I haven't tasted them yet, but this was super stressful! Definitely would not suggest.
These are incredible! Best gingerbread I've ever made. I used all of the modifications but white pepper instead of black and refrigerated overnight. Ignore my decorating please. 🤣

I've been looking for ages to get a good gingerbread recipe and this is it! I've had nothing but positive feedback from everyone who tries them. 
Some have commented that the dough is too wet, but you can get around that by mixing in more flour, or returning the dough to the fridge. take it out in small portions to reduce the time it sits out before being cut. Plus the softness means it re-kneads really well as well so you end up being able to use it all.  
I didn't decorate mine with icing as it looked too amateur with my icing skills. Instead I put colored sugar sprinkles on the tips of the Christmas trees, hands of the angels etc, and this looks Christmassy enough. Do that before baking or they don't stick. 
So good I made another batch, this time without enough Molasses so I made up the volume with regular golden syrup and they were fine.
Great recipe! The cookies came out soft and delicious! I didn't add the pepper (maybe next time) but I highly recommend the orange zest!
The best trick to rolled cookies is to mix and put in refigerator overnite and roll the next day. These gingerbread cookies turned out great, very flavorful.

I’ve never left a bad review before but these cookies genuinely have no flavor. They looked great coming out but the lack of taste was absolutely disappointing. I’ll be looking for a recipe with double or triple the amount of spice.
Thank you sooooo much!!! This is just what I was wanting to find.  Perfect flavor with the crisp outside, yet, chewable.
This was my first try with gingerbread cookies and this recipe was great! The tips were all spot on and the cookies turned out so yummy!
They turned out perfect and delicious!

description: This Christmas, we have everything you'll need to master this classic gingerbread cookie recipe. Plus watch our video to see how you can easily decorate these gingerbread men.
keywords: gingerbread cookies, gingerbread cookies recipe, gingerbread men cookies, gingerbread men cookies recipe, gingerbread cookie mix, soft gingerbread cookies, gingerbread man recipe, best gingerbread cookies, gingerbread men recipe, christmas gingerbread cookies, gingerbread icing
